alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 24 at 9:48PM CDT until November 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Rainfall amounts this evening of 1 to 2 inches have set the stage for additional runoff as additional waves of precipitation are expected this week. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 01... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Wednesday, November 01. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
